derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting an ecclesiastical pastor, also (still a Scots legal term) the guardian of a minor): from Old French curateur, in later use, directly from Latin curator, from curare (see cure). The current sense dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.tran: (博物馆或美术馆的)馆长，负责人
entry.def: A curator is someone who is in charge of the objects or works of art in a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: Peter Forey is curator of fossil fishes at the Natural History Museum.
example.tran: 彼得·福雷是自然历史博物馆鱼类化石展厅的负责人。

means.word_mean: 1. the custodian of a collection (as a museum or library)

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =run,表示"跑,发生,快速做……"; 2. =care,表示"关心"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 正确无误的;准确的,精确的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ac再+cur关心+ate……的→再关心,弄精确为止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 好奇的, 求知的, 古怪的, 爱挑剔的

stems_affixes.word_buile: accurate[[adj.正确无误的;准确的,精确的]]→n.准确[性];精确;准确度
cur关心+io→珍贵的被人多加关心的东西
cur关心+iosity多……的状态→关心多→好奇心
con共同+cur跑,发生,快速做……→共同跑→共同发生
in进入+cur跑,发生,快速做……→跑进来→招惹

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发生,出现;存在;想起,想到
stems_affixes.word_buile: oc向+cur跑,发生,快速做……→某个方向跑,发生

stems_affixes.value_cn: [尤指不好的事]一再发生;重现
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再次+cur跑,发生,快速做……→再次跑来
